slides.title: Simple Interest
slides.content:
**Simple Interest (SI):** Interest calculated only on principal

**Formula:**
SI = (P × R × T) / 100

Where:
- P = Principal
- R = Rate of interest per annum
- T = Time in years

**Amount = Principal + SI**

slides.title: Compound Interest
slides.content:
**Compound Interest (CI):** Interest on principal + previous interest

**Formula:**
Amount = P × (1 + R/100)^T

CI = Amount - Principal

**Example:** P=1000, R=10%, T=2 years
A = 1000 × (1.1)² = 1210
CI = 210

slides.title: Difference between SI and CI
slides.content:
**For 2 years:**
CI - SI = P × (R/100)²

**For 3 years:**
CI - SI = P × (R/100)² × (300+R)/100

**Key Point:** CI is always greater than SI for same P, R, T

slides.title: Special Cases
slides.content:
**When compounded half-yearly:**

R → R/2, T → 2T

**When compounded quarterly:**

R → R/4, T → 4T

**Example:** 10% p.a. for 1 year half-yearly
= 5% for 2 periods
